ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Loved this class! There's no reason that you should not take it. Everyone needs to learn how to work better with people, and facilitate meetings etc.This is a perfect way to learn how to do that better! The activities are actually really fun and you learn a lot about yourself (Strengths and weaknesses etc.)
Ona is an excellent instructor and the class was superb!

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: simulations and discussion of those activities
it's usefulness, it's length, the lecturer

The negotiation simulations were fantastic, and you absorb a lot during the lectures. It's a very time-efficient way of getting the big concepts. The other benefit is just seeing how Ona leads the course, and how she puts the principles she's teaching into practice.

I appreciated Ona's flexibility to address topics of interest. I also enjoyed her style of teaching, where she would teach us a new mediation tool by using it on the class and then bringing our attention to it after the fact. That was very helpful for us.

Practicing meeting facilitation and negotiation skills with classmates. Overall, the course made the oft-invisible processes of how to run a good meeting visible, and equipped me with tools I have and will continue to use.
It is very practical and applicable. The instructor practices what she teaches.
The activities, the fact that Ono models all of the techniques throughout the class so you get to see them in practice.
The simulations were great to get experience applying some of the concepts we have been learning about.
Ona is such an asset to this school. Her willingness to share stories and experiences was invaluable. She really cares about whether what she is teaching is applicable to students' lives.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: Nothing

The first two sessions could move a bit faster to get to more practice of mediation. I'm not sure how that could be done, but it felt like many of the concepts were easy to understand in theory, but much harder to practice. More practice would have been better. The outside assignments fell over spring break which I found was a difficult time to complete those things.
It would have been great if the course had been offered either in the fall so the skills we learned could be applied in future coursework in the spring semester.
Consider adding one or two more sessions to cover some topics more in depth. Consider adding a toolbox or summary of contents reviewed in class.
Nothing, my only regret is that this course wasn't a full three credit course!
The first class should not be on the Friday before spring break

The timing this year was tricky; having one class the Friday before spring break was not ideal, because several people who hadn't realized that setup ended up having to drop the class. It would be better to frontload this class at the beginning of the semester so that people don't feel overwhelmed by the time it starts.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: These are life and career skills, and I have no doubt that having taken this course will improve my performance on the job. Meetings, negotiations, public process - this stuff is the bread and butter of a career in the environmental field.

I am interested in stakeholder engagement in the policy process, and this course provided me with some basic meeting facilitation and conflict resolution techniques that have already come in handy in that domain.
It fits well for students interested in social processes, coflict resolution and environmental decision making.

It's so important to have the skills of a facilitator in the environmental community, and I wish we had the opportunity to talk more about actual instances besides the example ones that we role-played. But overall I know that I will take a lot of these things I've learned forward.

Facilitator and negotiation are important aspects of environmental work that are fundamental skills students should know despite their career path. This class inspired me to look into facilitation/mediation for a career.

I hope to be involved with organizations that convene many disparate groups to solve conflicts, so this course was central to getting a sense of that world. This is one of the only places at FES to learn about facilitation, mediation, and negotiation, including salary negotiation for soon-to-be graduates.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To be introduced to negotiation techniques and to learn to better manage meetings

To become more familiar with the concepts taught in this course. They're important, but you're often expected to pick them up by osmosis. Briefly walking through best practices and how things *should* be done is immensely useful.
To gain more comfort with facilitating multi-party collaborative processes.
I knew from other students that the course covers practical tools in just a few sessions on Fridays, which made it an easy choice.

I took it because I wanted some more experience with facilitation and wanted to develop more of the language around collaboration. The negotiation piece was also super helpful since I don't have a background in that. The skills we worked on in this class would be useful in any profession
I am interested in stakeholder engagement and this class was a great way to learn more skills for that.
Negotiation skills are critical for any professional.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes!
exceeded them!
Yes.
Yes
In general, the course met my expectations. I would have liked to cover some contents more in depth (such as multistakeholder negotiations), but it is also hard because of time constraints.
Yes! Above and beyond my expectations! Wish I could've taken this class for more credit!
yes!
Yes, very much so. I also appreciate that Ona offered to continue being a resource as we move into the next phases of our lives.
Yes, but intercultural differences were not considered.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: The group assignments/negotiation simulations were great.
good learning activity with the negotiations exercise
The group work included practicing negotiations and that was challenging and rewarding. Definitely a highlight of the course.
It was necessary for practicing negotiations.

I thought the multi-party negotiation was super useful and especially the debrief with class the following week. You could really sense how people's styles of communication were it influencing the results of the negotiation.
The group work was very important to my learning/practicing my skills.

Group negotiation excercises were SO useful, because in my imagination these types of activities were easy, but it was great to experience them as being VERY difficult. I would like to do more and really appreciated the chance we did have.
The group simulated different situations from real live to teach negotiating skills.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Definitely worthwhile
useful 1 credit course
It's definitely worth a couple of Fridays.
Definitely take this course - very practical skills.

The course is very practical and hands-on, but consider this an overview of different tools which may be a starting point for you to enter the field of negotiations, collaboration and facilitation processes.
Definitely take it! Listen! And put in some effort... It will be really worthwhile!
This is a fantastic course for those interested in learning some "hard" skills around negotiation and facilitation. I highly recommend!
Take it! Only three Fridays and you learn so much!
